reviews.review_msg: this class was okay. Logan is a good prof and gives good lectures. I was a bit frustrated with the grading on the final exam as the question was a broad questions (that had multiple answers) but only one answer was the correct one. paper was long but if you don't leave it until the last minute it is manageable

kind & u can tell that he's passionate about politics. Lecture slides tend to have paragraph sentences rather than concise information, but was honestly helpful in understanding information if u missed lecture. Midterm & final written essay questions worth a lot. Textbook chapters were very long but u can do okay in tests without reading it all.

I got an 'A' on the term paper, but did pretty mediocre on the midterm and final. Masilamani often veered into different topics without warning, which made the lectures a tad confusing but super interesting nevertheless. If you find the content interesting and do the readings, this class can easily be a GPA booster.

Not too bad of a class, the lectures were boring but he would make it interesting with jokes sometimes. The TA was extremely nice which also helped with the grades in the class. Over all id only take this class if its a requirement.

hes nice but ta's mark hard on the term paper which determines your grade,&criteria was unclear. classes were lowk boring i didnt go to them but still did good on the exams, just go the week before the midterm/final bc he will explain clearly whats gonna be on them and thats nice. overall not a bad class but didnt boost my gpa cuz of the term paper

Overrated, this is a bad gpa booster if you have other courses that matter. Lectures are a waste and grading is tough, and the 10 page paper is alright if you start early but if you dont get an A on it (which you probably won't) then a B is the best you can do overall, which is horrible for a random intro politics elective
nice prof but grades written answer questions on exams pretty unfairly. term paper also had weird restrictions

Logan was a good prof and I enjoyed his lectures. I found the essays to be a bit unfair as the written answer questions were marked pretty harshly. Also for the term paper, the restrictions on sources was kind of frustrating.
Logan was excellent.not sure what the reviewer is talking about. On point and good feedback.
Did not enjoy this class. Lectures slides were massive paragraphs. Professor was unclear on what was important to note & what was not. Would not take again
Terribly disorganized, has no clear grading scheme, had incorrect info on his slides. He is clearly checked out, waiting for retirement. DO NOT TAKE

Possibly the chillest prof I've seen at SFU. Grading is vague and he doesn't provide much feedback but as long as you stick to the material it'll be fine. Be sure to ask questions, especially if you're unsure about something during a test or lecture.

Logan consistenly sped through all of his lectures, failed to explain most of the material. Didn't assign any textbooks. Was consistently late to upload materials and marks. Poorly facilitated class discussions, was uninformed on the material he was supposed to be "teaching". Doesn't have a grading rubric, grades you on vibes only. good luck!

his classes are fairly easy but thats about it. always really short classes. most of the course i just read and learned from the textbook.didnt get much from the lecturers. approachable but seems like he does the bare minimum
Well the last class was a take home exam prep. Classes was meant for discussion time and not many read the readings. So classes were short

As we got deeper into the semester, lectures only got shorter and shorter and the last class was indeed 20 minutes or less. While at first it was nice getting to leave early, at a certain point it felt useless to come to class when it took way longer to get to campus than how long the lecture time was (esp when he just reads off 2/30 slides)

Average prof. He zoomed through powerpoints and lectures. Sure you get to leave ealy but theres no passion. Average grader. Also, he is culturally insensitive. He says things like "these ppl went through a little bit of a genocide" or "oh a few too many palestinains have died". There is no justice in his teaching. He seems scared to speak the truth

Professor Masilamani is an engaging lecturer who breaks down topics well. While attendance is mandatory, the textbook is essential for exam prep. Unstuck Study AI and the TA's tutorials really helped me stay on top of the material.

Logan is a terrible lecturer and incoherent. He tries freestyling the lecture off the top of his head but never ends up producing anything meaningful to say. attendance is mandatory but he cuts his lectures down to 20 mins and wastes everyones time. He is rude and uses a TM to grade everything despite this being an UD class. do not take his classes

Doesnt come to class.  When he does, classes are cut after 20 minutes.  Out of 13 weeks, we ran 2 tutorials and cancelled 3. Ignores emails or responds curtly.  Marks abstractly with no clear format or guidelines.

Mandatory lectures only went for 20min, he would just skip through a couple slides when there's like 30 of them. He doesn't give proper explanations or reasoning on email. Used a TM to do his marking which should not happen for upper classes.

He really doesn't care about his students. He will give u a low grade with virtually no explanation. Even if you memorize the class concepts, he wont be happy with SOMETHING and just mark you down. Half the time he doesn't even lecture because he's too lazy...literally 20 min classes and then you have to teach yourself. Don't take this class.

Dr. Masilamani was a very inspirational and discrete lecturer, my major isn't anything close to political science but it was still an intriguing class to attend. I highly recommend this course to anyone studying a political science or liberal arts major.

Papers and exams were fair but expectations weren't clearly explained. Prof cut half of the lectures more than an hour early which was annoying if you live far from SFU and chose to be there for this 8:30am class. Lecture slides are wordy so going to class isn't really necessary. Reading the textbook is mandatory, lot of exam questions from it.

Lectures were engaging and the prof was a funny guy. I got by without keeping up with textbook readings but I also have a strong interest/foundation in poli-sci. My TA was pretty useless but I had good tutorial classmates. I didn't think tests were that hard but they had some questions about briefly mentioned things or required some inferencing.

Didn't go to a single lecture and finished with an A. Textbook is free and optional to have. Slides are wordy so you don't need to go to class. Midterm, participation, final, and essay were all worth a lot but it's really easy to do well on them. Just be very familiar with information on slides. Don't really like PolSci but was a good class.

Great lecturer with engaging stories. He is straight to the point & sometimes ends lecture earlier. The TA I had for this course is great & has tutorials that require participation but nothing that is difficult. To get a good grade on the exams, brief over the textbook as the questions are all surface level.

Great prof, good testing

Logan is an engaging lecturer, course content is thorough and always accessible. Attendance isn't mandatory, but encouraged. TAs grade fairly and tests are well written, nothing is made to trick you

Great prof! clear lectures and breaks topics down to an intro course level. Only downside is he doesn't give outlines for the midterm or final which makes it stressful to study for and that your grade is only based on your final paper, midterm, final and participation which makes everything weighted heavily.
Logan was an excellent instructor. Class was fun and we learnt new aspects of Human Security. Will take a class with him again.

I think the reviewer below did not attend the same class that I did. Logan was an amazing lecturer. Gave us clear examples understand difficult issues. I do remember him saying outside of the course material.

Oftentimes brings up personal bias in lecture and presents a dismissive attitude towards an open minded discourse between him and students. Needs to be more open and willing to deliver culturally appropriate and sensitive materials.
Class was interesting, Logan is very knowledgeable about international studies. Is a bit of a tough marker.

Logan was a sweetheart. The textbook is only necessary to learn more about base concepts, the lectures really fill in the blanks. He tried his best to make the course material interesting, so the three hour lectures weren't stale and he gives good feedback.

I took Pol Intro with Prof. Logan and he is great, so was our TA. Would recommend him. Lectures are clear and discussion based. Assignments are decent, difficult but doable, if you read textbook & go to lecture.

Not the best prof,does not have clear instructions and does not communicate with his TA's. For final assignment the TA gave us a different deadline than him. His deadline on canvas was different and the one he said in person was different, but at the day it was due he switched the canvas date and apologized but still made us hand in at the same day

Prof. Masilamani is easily one of the best profs you can have for your first polisci class. He's incredibly knowledgeable and you can very easily tell he's really passionate about the content. The response time for an email was almost always within hour. On top of this, his tests are super fair. 10/10, and he made me want to minor in polisci

Logan is a great professor who is friendly and knowledgeable. He leads great lectures and his assignments/exams are reasonable and fair. I would recommend taking POL 100 as an elective, especially if you have a bit of an interest in politics.
Excellent instructor. Clear guidelines. The assignment simulation exercise was lots of fun. Very engaging prof. Will take again.
Excellent prof. Lectures were interesting. If you read the text and follow along with his instructions you should be fine.

Do not take as an elective. While lectures & content are interesting, Logan tends to rush through the content. Midterms & Finals were generally fair, although some questions were quite specific. Feedback on essays was extremely vague which made it difficult to improve. Class is not scaled and he marks hard, so class average hovers around a B-.

Logan was a great lecturer. His midterms and final both had very irrelevant material that most people would overlook. As for the term paper, he did not give feedback at all on how to improve. He is a tough marker and expects a lot from a first-year-level course. I took this course as an elective, and I regret it and do not recommend it.

Dr.Logan is an excellent professor! He's open to your questions and gets straight to the point with his answers. The participation marks go a long way so make sure to come to class and do the discussions. The midterms were very specific to the textbook so make sure you understand the theories and concepts well. Overall he's a great professor!

Dr. Logan is an easygoing prof and is a very good lecturer. However, the midterm included very specific questions that one would easily overlook or not study. I would suggest primarily using the textbook but the slides as a guide tool. Overall, the class is easy if you participate in discussions and put the work in.

Dr. Logan is very passionate about what he teaches and is a great lecturer. However, during office hours, he offers the bare minimum advice and vaguely repeats what is mentioned in class. When studying for tests, I found using the textbook only helpful and the lecture slides as a guide tool. Overall, Logan is a great prof, but it depends on the TA.

The second last reviewer still thinks that he/she is in high school. If you have an issue ask a question and Logan will reply to you. Deadlines are deadlines with him. He is wonderful and gets issues across in a sensible manner.

i am in the same class as the last reviewer and I think he/she is not very accurate in the review. Logan does not read off the powerpoints and gives excellent lectures. Follow the instructions and attend lectures and he is great.

walked into class in the first day and said he wish he didn't choose to do a phd and be a prof. I have never had a worse experience in uni with a prof. he has no communication and does not hold any accountability for his mistakes. prof and ta dont communicate. too much work for a level 100 class. boring lectures, just reads off slides.

IS 314*
Have never approached him out of class, but great lecturer & nice prof. We get well organized slides but no recording, so show up for lecture.
The simulation-debate group project was actually fun. I usually don't like presentations but this format was enjoyable.
The paper wasn't too hard to write & the exams were moderate difficulty.
He's awesome

Overall a good professor and a fair marker. He is clearly passionate and knowledgeable about the subject which is always nice. His tests never require you to remember years or any other numbers which is great.
Excellent prof. the group work was great and he was very accommodating.
His marking is inconsistent
Excellent prof. Course content was great. Followed his instructions and did well. Goes the extra mile for his students.
Put in the work and get the grade. No nonsense prof.
Excellent professor and very accommodating.
Logan was excellent and made me want to switch my major. He was accommodating and the course was not too difficult.

After reading the review below, I have to disagree. Logan was very accommodating. I think the student below did not explain the situation to Logan/TA. Logan gave me an extension on the essay and also allowed me to push my grade component to the final exam.

Least understanding professor I've ever had! My mom passed away and he refused to give me an extension for my final paper and increased my final exam % to 50% because I missed one test because I was at my mom's funeral. WORST TEACHER, NOT UNDERSTANDING AT ALL, GAVE ME A REALLY HARD TIME while I was already struggling.
Excellent course taught be a good prof. Everything was explained. Exams were easy and if you undertook the draft essay it helped with getting a better grade.
Excellent prof only fi you go to his office hours.

He's a fine professor in the sense that he posts all of his slides and doesn't give too many assignments, but his feedback on assignments is very little which is frustrating if you're trying to improve. Definitely disagree with the people saying he's the best prof in the department. There are a lot of better profs you can actually learn from.

Logan simply does not care in the best way possible. Just do the work (a reasonable amount) and you can do well in his courses. Doesn't expect a lot and is straightforward about his expectations. He always looks miserable while teaching and I love that about him. Honestly a great prof, just make sure you respect his deadlines and you'll be fine.

I took pol346 with logan and this is my second class with him. He is by far my favourite prof at sfu. He is personable and doesnt expect much from his students. All you need to do is show up to class and you will do great. Pol 346 was on a pretty boring topic, but Logan did make many aspects of it interesting. GOATED prof

Logan is by far my favourite professor at SFU. This was a chinese politics class and he provided multiple types of material like youtube videos which enhanced learning rather than just relying on a textbook. As long as you show up to class you will do great. There is also one group project, one paper, and one final exam.
Excellent prof. I had no issues with him or his TA. Grading was fair and consistent. Questions were all answered fully. A good introductory course.

Took course due to interest in the topic of Chinese Development and learned lots of new information. Lectures weren't actually boring compared to some other profs. Definitely a ton of writing in this course and I'm not a good writer. Marking feedback was concise and didn't mention how to improve. Not the prof for me but take the advice others gave.
Logan is great for an introductory class. I have changed my major because of him.
Logan is excellent. Yes he does not response to emails in full, but that is why you have office hours for. He will help if you show interest in the course.

Logan is ok at best. He is hard to reach and his email skills are the worst. The class is easy and he is a fair marker. However, he is very belittling and wont take the time of day to communicate. He makes no exceptions and is not flexible at all. would recommend this prof if you plan on having very little to no interaction with the prof.
Great instructor, teaching Southeast Asia. A region I did not much about. The grading was excellent.
Excellent instructor. Nothing much to do. Easy grader
Excellent prof. Nice individual and very helpful
Excellent prof. gets to the point. A very fair grader and not much work for a 3rd year level course
Excellent instructor who cared about the welfare of his students.
Excellent. No issues. Take him

This class by far was the best class I have taken at SFU. Logan is straight forward and likes work to be straight to the point. Make sure you have good writing skills and you will ace everything. Textbook was used and lectures are important along with not skipping any discussions. Midterm & final and paper were all easy! Just make sure you study
Excellent and wonders. take his class
Excellet courese
Excellent and wonderful class on political development. Fair marker and insightful lectures. This was a seminar course.
Excellent prof. This course was eye-opening.
Excellent guy. Great TA too. No worries al all.
Excellent. If you want to learn, Logan is the guy.
excellent instructor.
Excellent course
Great Prof.
Great Prof. Wonderful course.
worst lecturer at SFU
Logan is great. No issues. Follow all the instructions and you will do well.
The best prof. for Pol 100. I majored in Political Science and he was the one that got me started. Respected the students and took care of them.

Excellent course and an introduction to security studies. Logan was great and very helpful. Logan provided good lecture recordings and feedback on grading. TA was wonderful too. I will take another course with Logan
Logan was great. The course was informative. Grading was fair. I would take another course with him.
Excellent course with good instructor and TA. Both of them were always available for help. You need to put in effort to get a good grade. Will take another course with Logan
The course was structured well and everything was clear.
Course was great. Logan was informed and kept things on track. The TA was good too.
The Course was easy. I echo the comments in the last review. Logan was straight to the point and messing around. Was there if you needed help. Simple course, easy to get a good grade.

This class by far was the easiest class I have taken at SFU. Logan is straight forward and likes work to be straight to the point. Make sure you have good writing skills and you will ace everything. Textbook was used and lectures are important along with not skipping any discussions. Midterm & final and paper were all easy! Just make sure you study
Took the course many years ago and strongly believe that Logan is an excellent instructor. He understand issues and treats all students with fairness.
Logan is great. I asked if he could bump up my grade and he did. Will take him again. Instructions were clear and modules were concise. Lots of readings to do.
Logan was excellent. His knowledge about the subject matter was great. Very informal classes and gave extensions when needed. Will take a class again with him.
Logan was OK. I would not say the best, but he met all the requirements and was compassionate when it came to issues getting in the way of submitting work. I would take another course with him.
Excellent course and instructor. Content was relevant and helped with understanding the world. Logan is great and will take his other courses.
Not much work for this course. Readings and Presentations. Typical online course. Logan kept the course going. Better face to face, I think.
Course was simple and Logan was engaging. Kept things fast. No final exam. No stress in the course at all. Marked fairly.
Logan was wonderful Course material was a bit boring. But Logan made it good.
Excellent course. Wonderful professor
Logan was wonderful in teaching this course. He answered all questions and grading was on point.
Logan took student's concerns into consideration. He allowed extensions and was also available for help. Material was good and he covered it quite well. Not sure why the bad reviews below.
Logan is good, I will not say great. Being an online course it was difficult to get feedback, but he managed to steer the course well.
Not sure about the previous review, but Logan was great. Got a good grade with some amount of work. He does reply with one line, but what do you expect. Online courses requires a bit more work

Logan didnt make feedbacks after grading our assignments or research paper, he also reply short emails( just one line), he doesnt care for the students , and he is super unfriendly. Also he doesnt have clear grading criteria.
Excellent course. Online courses are horrible, but his structure is quite good.
Excellent introductory class. Logan handled the class well.
Logan was excellent. Online classes were great.

Ive taken classes with this prof both in person and online. He's an ok prof in person but online he is not the greatest. His instructions are not very clear and he is not easy to reach over email. Would not recommend him.
Logan is good, but the TA was difficult to understand. Lectures were on point. Should grade on a curve. Discussion time was also very helpful.
Logan was great. T.A. Was also wonderful. Pandemic has limited the teaching but course content was excellent.
Logan is an excellent lecturer. Online learning is difficult and he made the best use of what was available.

Taking the course with him was probably one of my biggest mistakes. He doesnt care about students, let TA did all the work. He cancelled so many lectures. Extremely lack of communication. You dont know what is going on in his class and he always tries to ghost you.

Ive taken IS101 (in person) and IS200 (pandemic online) with Logan. Ive enjoyed the content and hes a good lecturer. I was able to achieve an A in IS101, but on other hand Im hoping to get a B- in IS200. I would say the main difference is the difficulty level of the paper and the expectation of the TA you have more so than Logans teaching.
Does not really care about the students and will not help you with anything. Don't take his classes, you'll regret it
Just try to follow what he says; he is very cool and approachable. if you are not clear with anything just ask him, he is very cooperative. i like him!
Just u need to follow up his advices, he is really approachable and helpful.

Logan is very funny, and gives good lectures. He uses very many relevant examples within global issues from the past or recent which I find helps my understanding of the course concepts. However, his assignments are quite difficult and assign a lot of readings.

If you are at SFU then taking a class with him will increase your general understanding of politics. His knowledge and experience in the fields of IS and Politics is vast therefore students learn a lot

Logan's lectures are relatively clear and illustrates his points well. I only wish that he slowed down a bit! we often rushed through lecture, only to finish 20-30 minutes early (of a 2 hr lecture). The class wasn't too hard, and provided you put in the effort, you should get a decent grade. Overall, solid prof, and a cool dude
Awesome prof.

I found that attendance was not mandatory but he gives engaging lectures and elaborates well on his lecture slides. Fair marker over all and straightforward. I appreciate his humourous remarks in class. We also had a take home final as he had to take a trip overseas. Would definitely take another course with him.
Lecture is a bit boring but the fault is not on him. He is a fair marker on presentation. mid term and final exam. We also have a final take home exam.

Logan is very passionate about his area of studies and makes lectures interesting. The class was a writing heavy class which required a draft and final essay. The lecture is based of the slides which are sent to you. The essay is the hardest part of the class.

Material wasn't too interesting but that's not his fault. Only gave an 8-10 page paper which is nothing considering its a writing course. Final was a take home non-formal essay & we got 3 days to do it which alleviated stress but he might not do this every time. Pointless tutorials but he was easy. Would recommend just make sure you pay attention!
Makes you submit essay online checks for plagiarism for the topics that has chance of being same and conducts for plagiarism

Logan is a very clear, straight-forward prof. He explains well and often is interesting to listen to. Marks fairly and really helps prepare you for exams. Only possible downside would be heavy lecture slides, but they are made available to you prior to the lecture.
Great prof who rewards hard work--do your research. Very little leeway for late submissions or missed deadlines.
I have him for the fourth times now. i love his lecture and he tells you the general ideas what is going to be on the exam. perhaps, too much anti trump statements

Logan is an amazing professor. He sets clear expectations from the first lecture. The policy paper was a lot of work but it was so worth it in the end! The topics covered were very interesting and created interesting conversation.
Best professor at SFU. 100% professional and maintains good relationship with students.

Great lecturer, keeps my attention for the whole 2 hours. He is funny at times and the class in general is pretty easy. One of the best things i liked is that he sends everyone all the lecture slides. However, i'd suggest showing up to lecture still because he, again, is a great lecturer and it really helps to understand the material better.

Logan is amazing! He is the best professor in the political science department by far. His lectures were not only informative but really interesting. You will at least get an A- in this class if you pay attention to what he says. If you have him as your TA that is a bonus because he is a really fair marker.
Awesome professor! He has a good sense of humor and does his best to answer your questions. His lectures are very organized and easy to understand. His textbook is also an easy/interesting read.

Lectures were not mandatory. You have to read the textbook otherwise you will not do good. If you read it depending on your TA (mine was tough grader) you will get at least B+. I did not do very good on my paper still got a B+ overall. Paper is very long (10 pages). Need to put work into it

Great Prof! His exams are straightforward and short (takes no more than 90 mins to complete). But make sure to have some extensive knowledge on a political topic for the essay. Other then that, the M/C and the short answer are a breeze. Also, don't procrastinate with the 10 page paper like I did. It's very hard to do bad in this course w/ Logan.

His lectures felt a bit pointless unless you need things to be said to you to remember because he reads mostly off his power points. I had a hard marking TA so make sure yours is good since they mark your papers and assignmentsparticipation. Overall was decent just a bit boring sometimes.

Logan was a great prof, and the class was great! Because it is a 3 hour lecture with tutorial built in, we would usually get out early. His lectures are always informative and to the point. Really clear with his marking criteria and helped me enjoy the class!
This instructor is great. It was an intro. class so he provided simple concepts and themes. Tutorials were good and I learnt alot about the topic.
Not too helpful and respectful to students, ppt lectures made attendance not mandatory, long and boring essay to those who are not really into pol-sci. Don't re commend to others.
Class was great. Letcures were to the point.

He's passionate about the subject and his lectures are very interesting. The paper is long, but you get good feedback from it. His exams are reasonable, but they require that you study the textbook in detail. I would definitely take his class again!

I took this course as an elective. My TA was also my prof. I got an A on my term paper (it was easy).  Not a hard course, the content was similar to Social Studies in high school, but it took me a long time to go over the slides and the textbook. The lecture was not that boring. I recommend this course if you're interested in politics.

Straightfowardclear lectures and grading scheme and he's a nice guy.  Keeps lectures pretty funny. Easy enough if you study the lecture notesread the textbook. Feels like a high school socials course tbh. Have to write a 10 page paper if you take the W version (instead of POL 100).  Overall GPA booster
Great class, he always adds humor to his lecture.  Would recommend.
He was not helpful. The course was easy, but not a easy A course. Lecture notes were straightforward. He has a sense of humor. However, he doesn't respect the students who have different ideas.

Prof gives out super clear and easy to understand lectures. Most of the questions on his exams are from his lectures but there are a few from the textbook, and he literally tells you what the written questions are going to be. 10/10 would recommend gpa booster
Awesome prof! Try and take tutorial with him. My favourite prof from SFU.

Love this professor! Professor Logan explains his lectures really well, it's easy to understand and his midterm was really fair. He basically tells you what is on the midterm and final. However, the research paper topic requires a lot of time. As long as you put effort in it, then you will do good :) Strong recommend this class !!!!!

Overall an easy class with a good prof. You can get buy reading the textbook and going to mandatory tutorials, as notes are textbook based entirely. prof has a quiet sense of humor, likes his topic, and likes teaching. Exams were easy. What got my ass was the final paper, but that was entirely my fault. The topics demanded lots research.

I've taken 3 classes with him (all lower div). Highly recommended if you love POL/ IS. Approachable, funny, and knowledgeable. Quite vague with assignments so make sure you clarify if you're unsure about any component! Read the textbook for an A.
Decent prof, was much easier  than I had anticipated. I would definitely recommend him.

He is very chill and knows what he is talking about. His notes are very vague so attending lecture would be wise. If you attend lecture, reading the text book isn't too necessary. He makes the subject not dry, and puts humour into his lecture. Slides are sent to email every week. Approachable, and will clarify if needed
Take this class only if you want to raise your GPA, he is easy since he is only here for the money. Haven't made faculty in years because that would require extra effort.

Logan is an amazing prof. He's so chilled and funny. Makes the class laugh every time. He knows his stuff and does a good job communicating it to the class. I have taken 4 classes with him. Exams and marking are fair. I highly recommend
Awesome prof! Super generous marker when it comes to tests. Participate in tutorial and come to class then you won't need to read much at all. Essay was a bit harder!
He's a cool Dr. If you want good grades, try participating in class. Make sure he knows you/your name and Start up your term paper on time

Such a great professor and his classes are super interesting but sometimes would get boring because he doesn't show any media or video clips to break up the lecture. Midterm and final are pretty easy. I would recommended anybody who has an interest in politics to take him. Favourite professor so far. Very kind and passionate about the subject.

Literally the best professor I've ever had, I've taken 3 classes with him so far and I can't stress enough how great of a teacher he is! He really tries to make sure you understand what it is that he's teaching and he is very empathetic. Highly recommend him to anyone interested in poli sci!
Not very helpful. Tough marking! Be careful to take this course. One of the most difficult in a 100 level

great prof, easy midterm and final. most important part is he points out which question will be on the exam before each test. the essay is a little bit long and need to spend a lot of time to do the research. after all, excellent  prof!

Easily one of the easiest classes/nicest profs around. Even though everything seemed like common sense, he uses real life examples that I thought were interesting. He also kind of has a deadpan type of humor.
Good professor! Pay attention, study a little and try to get along with him! You can make it!
Good professor
He is generally a nice professor. As long as you read the textbook, you will do fine in his exams

Logan is one of the greatest teacher I have had thus far. I had absolutely no interest in politics prior to this class and I can honestly say I really enjoy it now. He makes sure not to scare first year pol sci students away and makes the class very manageable.

Easily the best prof I've ever had. I've had him for 2 classes now and I've done super well in both! He's very approachable and is well educated in what he teaches. Classes with him are not difficult because he actually tries to make sure you understand what you're learning.
the grading scheme was unfair.MCQs for exams were easy.

Very good professor. I had little interest in politics before this class, and only took it because I had to. Now I'm very interested in the subject. His lectures are concise, and he gives you a very clear indication what is going to be on the exam. Marking is fair, just put some effort in and you'll get a solid grade. The text is very interesting.

Study hard! Then you will be able to get an A! He is really fair in evaluating each student, along with the TAs, and he and the TAs were really helpful getting through this course. Really recommend him if students are going to take Political Science courses.
helpfil.
Sympathetic, fair, interesting, helpful. Brings clear examples to make you understand.

Logan is a funny, interesting prof who made political science fun.He needs to use the microphone, so consider sitting in the front row depending on your hearing ability. His exams are fair. Study selectively, he mentions in class that certain topics will be tested. =) SF, LT and RC
Good for lower division classes but not so much for upper division.  Marks tough for upper division essays and seems disinterested in teaching.

Excellent prof to take poli sci with, and I learned so much from him! I thought political science would be an absolute nightmare, but he has made it so much more interesting and bearable. I learned a lot in his class and he makes it fun!
i enjoyed pol class with him. Although lecture notes were short, it had all materials that we need to know. Exams were fair.

I found him to be a well-spoken individual. His lectures are 80% based on the textbook but he clarifies any points that may be confusing. Lectures are key as he tells you exactly what will be on the midterms and the final. I found him to be very approachable after class.

He shows no interest in his students or the subject in the lower levels. His boring power points are copy-paste from online, he makes a point to miss class or always finish early, and he states very clearly not to bother him, but use the TA's. He a prof who is there just because he has to be. No interaction with class, Ill never take him again.
Excellent and well worth the time spent
Excellent
Wonderful and cared for the interst of students
Excellent prof. Managed to make things great. Lectures well well-deliverd and received.

Amazing!!!!!!. Don't listen to the others who say he's terrible. I think we should have more professors like him who are clear and concise on what is expected. If you listen to him and attend lectures you will do great. Plus his class was so interesting and relevant to current events that I found it hard to fall asleep in any of his lectures.
He`s a good prof.One of my best infact!

I really don't understand why people are complaining about him. He is an awesome professor. His accent is so alluring and he makes the class so interesting. I learned so much from this guy then I could from any other professor. Also he doesn't exhaust the two hour maximum lecture time and lets us out early at times. He's the greatest nuff said
His powerpoint presentations every class sum up the reading material succintly and really help to organize your thoughts about the material.
good professor overall if u want a good grade pick him if you wann actually learn something pick him if you want a drinking buddy pick him
Such a boring class. Be aware he is a hard marker on term paper. His exams are little bit hard. If you dont wanna waste your money, take the course w/ other prof.
He inherited this class. Does not like the books assigned. His lectures are clear and concise. Tries to bring the class to the level of most of the students. Very helpful during office hours.

I don't know where they found this guy!!!  The Political Science department is slowly burying itself. His classes are so basic, so boring, so uncritical.  If you want an easy grade, take him. If you actually want your money's worth and an education, I suggest you find someone else.

extremely boring professor.  i could never sit through the entire 2 hours of the class.  by the way, the multiple choice questions he pulls them out of the practice multiple choice questions from his and aheard`s online site.
he is such a hard marker and essay even worths 35% .. take this course w/ other prof..

The Prof really knew his stuff about the subject matter but his lectures were terribly boring. Make sure you read through the main points in the text and take notes in lecture and you should be fine for tests. It was fairly easy but also quite boring.
Lectures are really boring but he knows what hes talking about, he was also my TA and hes a very reasonable marker and the class was very easy. I hate poli sci but it was an interesting class.
Rambles a lot during lecture, but clearly knowledgeable. Very hard marker for exams and term paper, but I still ended up with an okay mark.

Lecture:Just read through the slides (his has use the same slides for many years as I concerned)
 
 Grading:Totally unfair, the final essay count 35% in total grade. But he is a very hard marker...I should be happy because I got B from this class, but all my other courses are either A or A-...couple of my friends failed...

I have taken many distance courses at SFU, and the material is good. However, he is by far the worst distance TA ever. He had had minimal discussions, he replies to email weeks late and returns grades weeks late. He never checks his computer. Take this course in class!!!!! The material is great, but this prof by distance will turn you off IP.
He just reads off his slides, but encourages discussion and seems to be interested in the subject.  Not the most interesting prof, but his exams are easy!

The Professor is clear and well spoken, easy to understand. He encourages discussion and is not boring, you just have to get used to the teaching style. No MT, Final is a combinations of Lecture notes and textbook. Paper is marked fair and presentation is not hard if your prepared. Excellent prof!

very knowledgable about asian politics. he was born and raised in singapore so he knows a lot. Just make sure you participate and do well on the presentation. the paper is standard but his teaching style is really laid back. highly recommended! This professor should be a full time prof at sfu!
great prof. if you get off on the right foot with him and participate you get a minimum A- . our 4 hour classes barley lasted 2.5 hours, really relaxed teaching style... highly recommended prof!
Always there to help. Course material was well delivered and a very interesting class.
What a great prof.  Cares about students and I learned a lot!!!
Helpful and very clear in this seminar
Best prof. Excellent teacher and went the extra mile to help his students
Took him long time ago. Excellent notes and very helpful.
excellent teacher
Readings were easy. Easy marker. Lectures were informative

unbearable.  of all things, international politics should be interesting, but he absolutely butchered it. biggest dissapointment of my university career. i sometimes wondered if he had ever learned anything beyond how to read a text book. stunningly terrible.
Horrible.  Should not be teaching.
Lacked enthusiasm for the course, didn't learn anything, waste of time

Completely ruined what should have been an interesting class. Hard marker.
Uselss, useless, uesless, boring prof, will avoid at all costs
regret taking this course, poor lecturer and just bad!

lecture easy to follow if yr not lazy--midterm a bit hard
